ayah: Woe to every scorner and mocker
Who collects wealth and [continuously] counts it.[1987]
footnotes: [1987] Rather than spending in the way of Allāh.

ayah: He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.
No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.[1988]
footnotes: [1988] i.e., Hellfire, which crushes and destroys all that enters it.

ayah: And what can make you know what is the Crusher?
It is the fire of Allāh, [eternally] fueled,
Which mounts directed at the hearts.[1989]
Indeed, it [i.e., Hellfire] will be closed down upon them

footnotes: [1990] Interpreted to be either columns of fire or columns of iron to which are chained the inmates of Hell.
